contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} {{coord|36|15|43.73|N|46|41|16.11|E|display=title}} '''The castle at Ziwiyeh''' which has been ruined through digging for archaeological purposes, was an ancient and strong building situated on the top of a mount above the wide Ziwiyeh Cave, [[Iran]]. It is located in an altitude of 1,835 m above sea level in [[Kurdistan Province (Iran)|Kurdistan province of Iran]] on the south of [[Lake Urmia]]. Artefacts found there belong to the 9th century BC (belonging to [[Medes]] era) and have been kept in some museums. A large golden [[necklace]] with some mythical animals engraved on it is one of the most famous things found in the area. == See also == *[[Ziwiye hoard]] *[[Ziviyeh District]] [[Category:Castles in Iran]] [[Category:Iranian architecture]] [[Category:Kurdistan Province]] {{Iran-struct-stub}} {{Castle-stub}} {{Kurdistan Province}}
